creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: long red petal shaped form with top edges curving inward; horizontally oriented
text: Tanaka Nobuyuki studied lacquer at the Tokyo University of the Arts but teaches today at Kanazawa College of Art. In the 1990's he created three-dimensional works using dry lacquer on which he intentionally left the texture of hemp cloth. During the same period, he also developed works that were polished like a mirror. More recently, he has concentrated on pure form, exploring new dimensions in the ancient medium of lacquer.
title: The Tactile Memory: Floral Impression (2011-II)
